meanings.definition: To have doubts or suspicions about something.
meanings.sent3: The cat misdoubts the vacuum cleaner every time it comes out.
meanings.sent4: Her heart misdoubts the sincerity of his words.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds overhead made her misdoubts about the weather forecast.

meanings.definition: A feeling of uncertainty or suspicion.
meanings.sent1: His misdoubts about the plan were evident.
meanings.sent2: The team's success removed all their misdoubts.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful antics caused some misdoubts about its training.
meanings.sent4: The old house carried a sense of misdoubts in its creaking floors.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's kind smile dispelled any misdoubts the students had about the upcoming test.
